name: Tristan Parker
text: I reached out to Two Men and a Truck for a quote on a commercial move. I received a phone call with in a few minutes asking me the details of the move and scheduled a time for a rep to come do a walk through and give a quote.  The quote was very reasonable considering the what we were needing moved. We decided to go with a week day to move as it is cheaper than Fridays or Saturdays. The guys showed up on time and work ready! I can not say one thing bad about our move yesterday other than it was so incredibly hot and I felt so bad for them. Fabulous job! Fabulous crew! Fabulous experience! Keep up the good work guys!

resp.text: Hi Tristan, Thank you for choosing the Movers Who Care and sharing how your recent move went. We truly appreciate it and are so happy to have helped make the day easier!

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

name: Gypsy Spirit Underground
text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

text:

I will be using them constantly from now on.
It’s peace of mind to know that my artwork will travel to its new home and arrive in perfect condition.
Thank you, MailPro!!👩‍🎨

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! Always a pleasure to help our artists get their gorgeous art to where it's going!

name: Missy Fantusi
text: Nice greeting cards, last time I was there, I was waited on right away. That's great!!

name: Marsha Reynolds
text: Most convenient mailing store I have ever been to. I am never going back to the post office. The service at MailPro is outstanding and the staff is extremely helpful and lovely. Will definitely be back again and again.

resp.text: Ooooh thank you for the 5 stars! And thank you for letting us help you! Always a pleasure to be of service to sweet folks like you!

name: Steve Middlebrooks
text: I went in to ship a golf club today at Mail pro in Owens crossroads Alabama. There was a lady in front of me that went in no mask on and the lady at the counter told her just to put her package over there. I came in with no mask on she told me to go back out and get a mask! Does she know the time it takes for Covid-19 to spread is it a short time or a long time? Apparently she works for the CDC and she knows all about it to discriminate against who wears a mask and who does not. If that service wasn't bad enough they charged me $51 to ship a golf club which normally would cost $39 anywhere else. Save your money save your time and save your humiliation Don't go here.

resp.text:
Wow. Yes, two customers in a row walked right past our “masks required” sign that is posted on the door. The lady ahead of you could drop her prepaid off and go, you needed to be in the store longer. It would have been futile for her leave to get her mask and come back in - her task was complete.

I’m sorry you feel humiliated by being asked to be compassionate to those around us that haven’t had their vaccination yet. We are still trying to follow the current CDC guidelines, they are on the CDC website if you need a refresher.

And again, I’m sorry you felt the price to pack and ship your golf club was more than you wanted to pay. Generally the price for clubs to be packed and shipped runs between $25-$35. The weight, dimensions and destination for this particular package determined the options we gave you. We would have gladly handed it back to you if you had wanted, so you could “price shop” and maybe find an option that better suited your price range.

As always, you are welcome in our store in the future provided you can be considerate and compassionate to the other shoppers.

name: Kim Ringenbach (looneypumpkin)
text: Mail Pro is the best place to ship from in Huntsville! The staff is super friendly and quick! I've never had an issue and the owner is the best!

name: Garel 2008
text:
My wife sent an international mail to the Philippines with very important papers and very expensive. She had the wrong address on the package. She found out when she returned home, called them and they went through all the outgoing mail and found it and changed the address label in time. Great job! We will use MailPro again and with a great level of confidence.

Thanks! MailPro

resp.text: Aw! Thank you for the great review! Always happy to help, glad to get a package where it's supposed to go! Thanks for coming to see us!

text: Fantastic business! I have shipped dozens of packages through them. Everything from legal papers to expensive fragile music instruments, and they have packaged and shipped everything perfectly. Love how convenient they are.

name: Tee West
text: Would give minus 5 stars if possible. Owner very rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A  package was processed couple months ago to Amazon from different person in store Today owner refused and said they DID NOT do the package before when in fact it was. Owner needs to learn how to actually run this store sufficiently. I'd been embarrassed to admit I was owner with that attitude. I just read your reply and trust me you were rude and have no intentions of ever doing service here again. That shows bad character on your part for reply such as that!!!!!!! What an arrogance!!!

resp.text:
LOL!! Yes, I had the audacity to disagree with you... I'm sorry, you are simply mistaken. You chose the Amazon QR code that clearly states on your return for you to take the QR to branded UPS Store for them to scan.

We are MailPro, a UPS Authorized Shipping Outlet and can take Amazon returns with a UPS label when you choose "UPS Dropoff", our scanners can't scan UPS Store QR codes.

Last time I'm sure we showed you how to cancel your return, and re-return it as a "UPS Dropoff" to process it for you. We do this approximately 20 times a day for all of our fabulous customers.

I tried to show you how change your return but you were not receptive, choosing instead to be offended. Next time when you bring your QR code in - we'll be sure to walk you through each step so you can understand the process. Life is too short to go through it looking to be offended..

text: Great service and convenient location for mailing packages and returns to Amazon.

resp.text: Aw thanks! It's a pleasure to help!

text: Fast, friendly, helpful - LOVE MailPro! I always bypass the Post Office for the ease and convenience of this local mailing center. They are the nicest and can't beat their amazing service!

name: Lacey House
text: Fast service, friendly and professional staff, and many services available! I witnessed so many happy and satisfied customers while I was in today! I Definitely recommend this business for all your shipping, binding, and packaging needs! Their location is also very convenient! Thanks MailPro!

resp.text: Thank you! Your business is very much appreciated and please come again soon!

name: Richard McCollum
text: They lost a FedEx package we sent. It has been a huge inconvenience for lots of people (and will continue to be for awhile). MailPro claims FedEx lost the package, but FedEx never scanned the package saying they picked it up, which leads me to believe MailPro lost it. FedEx claims MailPro lost it. Either way I really don't care, huge pain, never using the company again even though they are convenient.

resp.text: We are terribly sorry for your inconvenience. Your package did get picked up by FedEx, and we do have the manifest that the driver signed. It is rare that a package doesn't get scanned at the hub, but it does happen. We are sorry it happened to your package. All we can do is reimburse you for your shipping charge, which we have done.

name: Rebecca Jensen
text:
I was in Mailpro yesterday. The lady with dark hair and bigger was ugly to me in front of customers. I was there before the lady she was waiting on and asked her a question. That’s when she got mad and said she was waiting on someone else. I then said that I was there first and she went off on me even pointing out that I had crossed the line when I parked. She gave me the email I needed to send my package with and really though t I would send package thru her after her behavior. I paid 11 cents and left. I will never go in that horrible store again.

Your negative reply truly reflects the attitude you had toward me. Most reputable businesses try to correct the problem or apologize. They do not retaliate or make snarky comments.

resp.text:
Every customer is important and appreciated in our store. But we do expect our customers to act with basic manners learned in kindergarten. You did enter the store first and began your Wayfair return on your phone at the counter. While you were being helped by Wayfair I began helping a customer that came in and was ready.

You interrupted this transaction to tell me to look for the Wayfair email. I explained to you that I was helping another customer and I would help you as soon as her transaction was completed. You said "But I was here first!" And I replied "But you weren't ready." I was not unkind to you, I was not rude. I also mentioned that had parked diagonally in two spaces - to which you replied "I've got a new car..." Wow.

I see you have sent four packages through us in the last two years. If you want to take you business elsewhere, that's your choice. Of course, you are still welcome continue to drop off your prepaid returns with us in the future.

name: Robert Lee
text: I'm literally in here all the time shipping random items or sending certified mail. The service is always great. Thanks for being awesome! I'm sure I'll see you sometime today to ship something else!

resp.text: Thank you! We strive to be of service, and appreciate your business!

name: CurlyCutie
text: My daughter and I just experienced the most horrendous display of racism and bigotry from the "owner" of this location that I have yet to encounter in this area.  I own a small business that I run out of my home in McMullen Cove (and yes, I do have a license with the City of Huntsville).  I mail packages on a daily basis.  Today, I missed my mail pick up and our local post office had already closed so we drove down to this store so that we could ensure our packages would go out today.  My 12 year old went in first and was refused service.  So, I then took the packages and went inside only to be told that, "I don't receive anything from the Post Office for compensation and am not required to provide service to you."   I asked for her to put that in writing, she refused, spewed some other nastiness until 2 other individuals came in and I told her I would be reporting her to the proper authorities and I left.   As I type this, I am still shaken, that this kind of bigotry and hatred can still exist.  That people feel they have the right to treat others with such vile.  I will not be returning to this location ever and would strongly urge others to also find somewhere else to spend your hard earned money.

resp.text: Wow, I feel I have to respond to this - this goes beyond misleading and is simply a lie. There were others in the store that were witness to your extremely rude, and bullying behavior Saturday afternoon. I'm so sorry that we couldn't help you, and that you were not happy here. We really try hard to make every customers experience here a very good one. As I explained to you when you were here - your postal labels would not scan. I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

text: I'm in this store at least 3 times a week for something - they help me with everything. The Cove is lucky to have this little store, the workers are always knowledgeable, efficient, and cheerful. Thanks y'all! A+++++

text: The overall atmosphere isnt the same ,   I got some bad looks when I dropped off a return since I was only using the drop box and not paying to return through them

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear you feel this way. May I ask what we can do to improve your experience or correct the problem?

name: Britton Ethridge
text: Went for help with a difficult Amazon return, & the very helpful staff worked with me to return the packages with no charge! Angeline was especially kind. Will be returning.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

text: MailPro is the place to go when I need to ship a package. But it's also great for so many other things - notary services, live fingerprinting, moving supplies, copies, print jobs, etc.  - basically it's a one stop shop - convenient, courteous owners and employees, and fair prices.

Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

name: Gypsy Spirit Underground
text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

I think they are hoping we would forget about most of the things!! Of course, after not hearing from them this last time for 5 weeks, they simply said, "we were waiting for YOU to call back!"
For this reason I would not recommend them!!!
Especially if you are moving valuables!!!

Fabulous experience! Keep up the good work guys!

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

resp.text: We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Gypsy Spirit Underground
text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

I think they are hoping we would forget about most of the things!! Of course, after not hearing from them this last time for 5 weeks, they simply said, "we were waiting for YOU to call back!"

text: Two men in a truck were professional and took great care of moving our stuff. Would recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for the opportunity to serve you!

name: Rapheal Jackson
text: Two men and a truck IN is great but ran by horrible people. TmT Mobile, looking for drivers??

resp.text: Good morning Raphael. I wanted to thank you for your 4 star review but wish to discuss the comments with you. You can reach the Mobile office at 251-316-5977. We'd be happy to speak with you anytime!

name: Houston Barnhill
text: Called multiple times and left messages, never received a call back.

resp.text: I’m so sorry you had this experience. Our brand is built on exceeding our customers expectations. Our intention is never to let a customer go unanswered. We provided you with an estimate on 5/31 but you didn’t book with us at that time. We searched our voicemail and web lead databases and did not find a record of your calls. We certainly apologize that we let you slip through the cracks. Thank you for thinking of us first.

name: M Barnes
text: Excellent service!

resp.text: Thank you for the opportunity to serve you!

name: Sean Miller
text: Guys know how to work

resp.text: Thank you so much for the opportunity to serve you!

name: Manohar Rajan
text: Kept slashing hours and estimates were hugely reduced as a 10 hour job was often reported as a 7 or 8 and sometimes even 5 would be around 7-8 etc. Pay was very low for work.

resp.text: We are sorry Manohar your experience at Two Men and a Truck wasn’t what you had hoped it would be. Estimates are based on the work habits of an average moving crew. Hard work with a smile just isn’t for everyone. We wish you future success in all your endeavors.

name: gary sullins
text: Very professional

resp.text: Thank you so much for opportunity to serve you!

text:
I am a Artist, once a canvas has sold, it must be crated and shipped. The Owner by the name of Angeline and her staff are very helpful, patient, quick and very professional.
I will be using them constantly from now on.
It’s peace of mind to know that my artwork will travel to its new home and arrive in perfect condition.
Thank you, MailPro!!👩‍🎨

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! Always a pleasure to help our artists get their gorgeous art to where it's going!

name: Missy Fantusi
text: Nice greeting cards, last time I was there, I was waited on right away. That's great!!

name: Marsha Reynolds
text: Most convenient mailing store I have ever been to. I am never going back to the post office. The service at MailPro is outstanding and the staff is extremely helpful and lovely. Will definitely be back again and again.

resp.text: Ooooh thank you for the 5 stars! And thank you for letting us help you! Always a pleasure to be of service to sweet folks like you!

name: Steve Middlebrooks
text: I went in to ship a golf club today at Mail pro in Owens crossroads Alabama. There was a lady in front of me that went in no mask on and the lady at the counter told her just to put her package over there. I came in with no mask on she told me to go back out and get a mask! Does she know the time it takes for Covid-19 to spread is it a short time or a long time? Apparently she works for the CDC and she knows all about it to discriminate against who wears a mask and who does not. If that service wasn't bad enough they charged me $51 to ship a golf club which normally would cost $39 anywhere else. Save your money save your time and save your humiliation Don't go here.

resp.text:
Wow. Yes, two customers in a row walked right past our “masks required” sign that is posted on the door. The lady ahead of you could drop her prepaid off and go, you needed to be in the store longer. It would have been futile for her leave to get her mask and come back in - her task was complete.

I’m sorry you feel humiliated by being asked to be compassionate to those around us that haven’t had their vaccination yet. We are still trying to follow the current CDC guidelines, they are on the CDC website if you need a refresher.

And again, I’m sorry you felt the price to pack and ship your golf club was more than you wanted to pay. Generally the price for clubs to be packed and shipped runs between $25-$35. The weight, dimensions and destination for this particular package determined the options we gave you. We would have gladly handed it back to you if you had wanted, so you could “price shop” and maybe find an option that better suited your price range.

As always, you are welcome in our store in the future provided you can be considerate and compassionate to the other shoppers.

name: Kim Ringenbach (looneypumpkin)
text: Mail Pro is the best place to ship from in Huntsville! The staff is super friendly and quick! I've never had an issue and the owner is the best!

name: Garel 2008
text:
My wife sent an international mail to the Philippines with very important papers and very expensive. She had the wrong address on the package. She found out when she returned home, called them and they went through all the outgoing mail and found it and changed the address label in time. Great job! We will use MailPro again and with a great level of confidence.

Thanks! MailPro

resp.text: Aw! Thank you for the great review! Always happy to help, glad to get a package where it's supposed to go! Thanks for coming to see us!

resp.text: Sorry we missed you. We were open Monday from 9 til around 1:30pm when the temperature dropped below freezing. My employees live over the mountain and I made the decision to remain closed today at 6:30 this morning when the news was reporting that schools, redstone and colleges were closed.

text: Fantastic business! I have shipped dozens of packages through them. Everything from legal papers to expensive fragile music instruments, and they have packaged and shipped everything perfectly. Love how convenient they are.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review! It's pleasure to help you with all your tasks. Thank you for being a great customer!

name: Tee West
text: Would give minus 5 stars if possible. Owner very rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A  package was processed couple months ago to Amazon from different person in store Today owner refused and said they DID NOT do the package before when in fact it was. Owner needs to learn how to actually run this store sufficiently. I'd been embarrassed to admit I was owner with that attitude. I just read your reply and trust me you were rude and have no intentions of ever doing service here again. That shows bad character on your part for reply such as that!!!!!!! What an arrogance!!!

resp.text:
LOL!! Yes, I had the audacity to disagree with you... I'm sorry, you are simply mistaken. You chose the Amazon QR code that clearly states on your return for you to take the QR to branded UPS Store for them to scan.

We are MailPro, a UPS Authorized Shipping Outlet and can take Amazon returns with a UPS label when you choose "UPS Dropoff", our scanners can't scan UPS Store QR codes.

Last time I'm sure we showed you how to cancel your return, and re-return it as a "UPS Dropoff" to process it for you. We do this approximately 20 times a day for all of our fabulous customers.

I tried to show you how change your return but you were not receptive, choosing instead to be offended. Next time when you bring your QR code in - we'll be sure to walk you through each step so you can understand the process. Life is too short to go through it looking to be offended..

name: Christopher Coleman
text: Great service and convenient location for mailing packages and returns to Amazon.

resp.text: Aw thanks! It's a pleasure to help!

text: Fast, friendly, helpful - LOVE MailPro! I always bypass the Post Office for the ease and convenience of this local mailing center. They are the nicest and can't beat their amazing service!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing us! It is our pleasure to help!

I Definitely recommend this business for all your shipping, binding, and packaging needs! Their location is also very convenient! Thanks MailPro!

resp.text: Thank you! Your business is very much appreciated and please come again soon!

name: Richard McCollum
text: They lost a FedEx package we sent. It has been a huge inconvenience for lots of people (and will continue to be for awhile). MailPro claims FedEx lost the package, but FedEx never scanned the package saying they picked it up, which leads me to believe MailPro lost it. FedEx claims MailPro lost it. Either way I really don't care, huge pain, never using the company again even though they are convenient.

resp.text: We are terribly sorry for your inconvenience. Your package did get picked up by FedEx, and we do have the manifest that the driver signed. It is rare that a package doesn't get scanned at the hub, but it does happen. We are sorry it happened to your package. All we can do is reimburse you for your shipping charge, which we have done.

name: Rebecca Jensen
text:
I was in Mailpro yesterday. The lady with dark hair and bigger was ugly to me in front of customers. I was there before the lady she was waiting on and asked her a question. That’s when she got mad and said she was waiting on someone else. I then said that I was there first and she went off on me even pointing out that I had crossed the line when I parked. She gave me the email I needed to send my package with and really though t I would send package thru her after her behavior. I paid 11 cents and left. I will never go in that horrible store again.

Your negative reply truly reflects the attitude you had toward me. Most reputable businesses try to correct the problem or apologize. They do not retaliate or make snarky comments.

resp.text:
Every customer is important and appreciated in our store. But we do expect our customers to act with basic manners learned in kindergarten. You did enter the store first and began your Wayfair return on your phone at the counter. While you were being helped by Wayfair I began helping a customer that came in and was ready.

You interrupted this transaction to tell me to look for the Wayfair email. I explained to you that I was helping another customer and I would help you as soon as her transaction was completed. You said "But I was here first!" And I replied "But you weren't ready." I was not unkind to you, I was not rude. I also mentioned that had parked diagonally in two spaces - to which you replied "I've got a new car..." Wow.

I see you have sent four packages through us in the last two years. If you want to take you business elsewhere, that's your choice. Of course, you are still welcome continue to drop off your prepaid returns with us in the future.

name: Robert Lee
text: I'm literally in here all the time shipping random items or sending certified mail. The service is always great. Thanks for being awesome! I'm sure I'll see you sometime today to ship something else!

resp.text: Thank you! We strive to be of service, and appreciate your business!

name: CurlyCutie
text: My daughter and I just experienced the most horrendous display of racism and bigotry from the "owner" of this location that I have yet to encounter in this area.  I own a small business that I run out of my home in McMullen Cove (and yes, I do have a license with the City of Huntsville).  I mail packages on a daily basis.  Today, I missed my mail pick up and our local post office had already closed so we drove down to this store so that we could ensure our packages would go out today.  My 12 year old went in first and was refused service.  So, I then took the packages and went inside only to be told that, "I don't receive anything from the Post Office for compensation and am not required to provide service to you."   I asked for her to put that in writing, she refused, spewed some other nastiness until 2 other individuals came in and I told her I would be reporting her to the proper authorities and I left.   As I type this, I am still shaken, that this kind of bigotry and hatred can still exist.  That people feel they have the right to treat others with such vile.  I will not be returning to this location ever and would strongly urge others to also find somewhere else to spend your hard earned money.

resp.text: Wow, I feel I have to respond to this - this goes beyond misleading and is simply a lie. There were others in the store that were witness to your extremely rude, and bullying behavior Saturday afternoon. I'm so sorry that we couldn't help you, and that you were not happy here. We really try hard to make every customers experience here a very good one. As I explained to you when you were here - your postal labels would not scan. I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

name: Judy Malone
text: I'm in this store at least 3 times a week for something - they help me with everything. The Cove is lucky to have this little store, the workers are always knowledgeable, efficient, and cheerful. Thanks y'all! A+++++

resp.text: Thank you Judy! We love to make our customers happy.

text: I love how convenient this place is and I’ve never had a negative experience at this store.

resp.text: Well, the sweet people in this area, like you, make our job easy! Thank you so much for your kind review!

name: Marie Channer
text: LOVE! this store!  They are the go to place for my shipping.  They even mailed a grandfather clock....no problem they said.  Thank you MailPro!!!

resp.text: I remember the clock! Thank you for your business and the packing challenge!

name: chris anderson
text: The overall atmosphere isnt the same ,   I got some bad looks when I dropped off a return since I was only using the drop box and not paying to return through them

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear you feel this way. May I ask what we can do to improve your experience or correct the problem?

name: Britton Ethridge
text: Went for help with a difficult Amazon return, & the very helpful staff worked with me to return the packages with no charge! Angeline was especially kind. Will be returning.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

name: Wes Haley
text: MailPro is the place to go when I need to ship a package. But it's also great for so many other things - notary services, live fingerprinting, moving supplies, copies, print jobs, etc.  - basically it's a one stop shop - convenient, courteous owners and employees, and fair prices.

I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

name: Judy Malone
text: I'm in this store at least 3 times a week for something - they help me with everything. The Cove is lucky to have this little store, the workers are always knowledgeable, efficient, and cheerful. Thanks y'all! A+++++

resp.text: Thank you Judy! We love to make our customers happy.

name: Gaybrielle Valverde
text: I love how convenient this place is and I’ve never had a negative experience at this store.

resp.text: Well, the sweet people in this area, like you, make our job easy! Thank you so much for your kind review!

name: Marie Channer
text: LOVE! this store!  They are the go to place for my shipping.  They even mailed a grandfather clock....no problem they said.  Thank you MailPro!!!

resp.text: I remember the clock! Thank you for your business and the packing challenge!

name: chris anderson
text: The overall atmosphere isnt the same ,   I got some bad looks when I dropped off a return since I was only using the drop box and not paying to return through them

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear you feel this way. May I ask what we can do to improve your experience or correct the problem?

name: Britton Ethridge
text: Went for help with a difficult Amazon return, & the very helpful staff worked with me to return the packages with no charge! Angeline was especially kind. Will be returning.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

name: Wes Haley
text: MailPro is the place to go when I need to ship a package. But it's also great for so many other things - notary services, live fingerprinting, moving supplies, copies, print jobs, etc.  - basically it's a one stop shop - convenient, courteous owners and employees, and fair prices.

name: Brandon Stapler
text: Awesome folks

name: Pat Carpenter
text: Very convient. . Good service. Everything you need for mailing in one place.

name: Steve Vaughan

resp.text: We don't have you in our records as a customer... Wrong store? Our prices are competitive with all the other pack and ship stores.

name: Gameu911 Gameutoo
text: I would not recommend any other U-Haul in Montgomery. These people were nice courteous and fair upon me choosing the vehicle that I wanted. The vehicle was also clean on the inside as you can check the videos to see. The items that they sell here are not overpriced and fairly priced. Highly recommended if you're going to use a U-Haul you need to use this one. And the storage facilities are $50 per month you can't beat that. They are also setting up an inside storage as well.

name: FreeThe People
text:
Zero star. Worst company ever. Didnt have my truck or trailer ready. Didnt have the pock up I ordered  (20 mpg )
Gave me a box truck I didnt want ( 10 mpg ) sent me too 3 other locations for the tow dolly. A 188 dollar bill turned into 265. Customer svc siad it's not thier fault. I knew what i was getting on too. Spent 3 hrs on hold and got hung up on several times.
Dont ever use uhaul. Go enterprise.
Big middle finger you haul. I hope they go bankrupt.
